step_name: I have a _layouts directory
glue_code:
Given(%r!^I have an? (.*) directory$!) do |dir|
  unless File.directory?(dir)
    then FileUtils.mkdir_p(dir)
  end
end

step_name: I have a "_layouts/999.html" file with content
glue_code:
Given(%r!^I have an? "(.*)" file with content:$!) do |file, text|
  File.write(file, text)
end

step_name: I have an "index.html" page with layout "custom" that contains "page content"
glue_code:
Given(%r!^I have an? "(.*)" page(?: with (.*) "(.*)")? that contains "(.*)"$!) do |file, key, value, text|
  File.write(file, <<~DATA)
    ---
    #{key || "layout"}: #{value || "none"}
    ---

    #{text}
  DATA
end

step_name: I have an "index.html" file with content
glue_code:
Given(%r!^I have an? "(.*)" file with content:$!) do |file, text|
  File.write(file, text)
end

step_name: I run jekyll build
glue_code:
When(%r!^I run jekyll(.*)$!) do |args|
  run_jekyll(args)
  if args.include?("--verbose") || ENV["DEBUG"]
    warn "\n#{jekyll_run_output}\n"
  end
end

step_name: the "_site/index.html" file should exist
glue_code:
Then(%r!^the "(.*)" file should +(not )?exist$!) do |file, negative|
  if negative.nil?
    expect(Pathname.new(file)).to exist
  else
    expect(Pathname.new(file)).to_not exist
  end
end

step_name: I should see "page content layout content" in "_site/index.html"
glue_code:
Then(%r!^I should (not )?see "(.*)" in "(.*)"$!) do |negative, text, file|
  step %(the "#{file}" file should exist)
  regexp = Regexp.new(text, Regexp::MULTILINE)
  if negative.nil? || negative.empty?
    expect(file_contents(file)).to match regexp
  else
    expect(file_contents(file)).not_to match regexp
  end
end

  regexp = Regexp.new(text, Regexp::MULTILINE)
